verses.roman:
hena-kāle āilā tathā rāghava paṇḍita
hāsite lāgilā dekhi' hañā vismita

synonyms: hena-kāle—at this time; āilā—arrived; tathā—there; rāghava paṇḍita—the great scholar named Rāghava paṇḍita; hāsite lāgilā—began to laugh; dekhi'-seeing; hañā vismita—being astonished.
translation: At that time, Rāghava Paṇḍita arrived there. Seeing the situation, he began to laugh in great surprise.
